creator: bigwhitecow@hotmail.com
text:
I am running 1.3.33 and i found that if I had apache configured to listen on an
invalid IP address (one that didn't belong to any interface), apachectl would
not return non-zero, but apache of course would not start. (and so my startup
scripts just pretended apache started with no problem)

Is this a problem that can be fixed?

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
This is fixed, but in 2.0 and above, where it required some redesign to move the
point in initialization where listening sockets were opened so that the console
logging is still available.
